intro: Pyrrocoma lagopus, commonly known as the snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cold climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine pubescence. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are white or pale blue and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
